Nzalambi is a 42-year-old woman. She is married with three children. She owns a butcher shop. She has five years of experience. She has one assistant and rents this shop to sell meat. She usually sells beef and mutton. She starts her business in the morning to buy cattle and sheep, and then she prepares the meat for sale.

Fresh meat is very popular in Mwambalazi, where Nzalambi comes from, and people use it in everyday dishes. The main challenge in her business is that there is not enough fresh meat to meet the demands of her customers. 

Nzalambi has now approached for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy sheep and cattle for the butcher.

loans.use: to buy sheep and cattle for the butcher.

loans.name: Henoch

texts.es:
Don Henoch tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Trabaja como carpintero desde los 15 años de edad; lo aprendió de su padre. Antes don Henoch se dedicaba a la agricultura. Él posee su propia carpintería, y la madera la compra en un lugar esta a cincuenta minutos de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 250 varas de madera de cedro y de Cortez. De esta manera, podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, ya que tiene unos encargos que hacer, como roperos, camas y sillas. Al cumplir con los pedidos podrá recibir ingresos que le permita mantener a su familia más cómoda. Él desea, comprar más maquinaria para su taller, madera para ganar más; para que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Henoch is sixty-six years old, is married, and has one son.  He has worked as a carpenter since he was fifteen years old; he learned from his father.  Before this, he worked in agriculture.  He has his own carpenter's shop, and he buys the wood from a place that is fifty minutes away from his house.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 250 rods of cedar and Guayacan.  In this way, he will be able to meet the demand of his clients, since he already has some orders he needs to fill, for items like bureaus, beds, and chairs.  In completing these orders, he will be able to receive the income that allows him to maintain a more comfortable life for his family.  

He wants to buy more machines for his workshop and more wood in order to make more items so that his family is not in need of anything.

loans.use: to buy 250 rods of cedar and Guayacan.

loans.name: Yveth Vanesa

texts.es: La Sra. Yveth tiene 23 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida ella vende salchipapas, tiene su puesto de venta  que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Piñami,  este préstamo es el primero que tiene con la institución, la Sra. Yveth va a usar este préstamo para compra de  insumos como papa, aceite y demás productos que  utiliza para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra. Yveth va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios para la venta se salchipapas ya que quiere seguir mejorando en su negocio y  poder expandirse ya que tiene mucha clientela y ella desea brindar comodidad y variedad de platillos a su clientela.
texts.en: Sra. Yveth is 23-years old.  She makes her living selling the fast-food "salchipapas," a Latin American dish that consists of thinly sliced pan-fried beef sausages and French fries mixed together and served with different sauces.  She has a sales post in the Piñami zone.  This loan is her first with the institution.  Sra. Yveth is going to use the loan to purchase supplies, like potatoes, oil and other products that she uses to make her food.  Sra. Yveth is going to use the benefits to purchase utensils she needs for selling "salchipapas."  She wants to continue improving her business and to be able to expand, as she has a lot of customers and she wants to offer convenience and a variety of plates to her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making "salchipapas" (a Latin American fast food made of thinly sliced pan-fried beef sausages and french fries mixed together and served with different sauces)

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 19-year-old single Lebanese man living with his parents and three siblings, one of whom is working. He is the main income source of the family. Despite his young age, he decided to get involved in the car trading business, although he knows that he may faces some difficulties at the beginning. Due to his clever negotiation skills and great personality, he was able to succeed in this domain. But his financials were hardly helping him covering the high cost of living, that's why he asked for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to prepare the needed registration papers for one of the cars he owns to be able to sell it. His purpose is to better develop his business, and this is how he works every day to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to prepare the needed registration papers for one of the cars he owns

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is 47 years old.  She is married and has 2 children aged 22 and 18.   Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizer.  In the future, Krishna plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

More than 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 37-year-old divorced mother of three children who live with her; two attend school. After divorcing her husband, Mariam started up a small grocery business as a source of income in order to look after her family and pay the children's tuition.

Mariam is requesting a loan of 400,000 shillings to buy more groceries for her business. Her dream is to expand it so that she can better care for her family and complete her residential house. Because she is faced with the challenge of limited capital, Mariam hopes lenders will give her a hand.

loans.use: To buy more groceries.

loans.name: Dore

texts.es: La Sra. Dore tiene 45 años y es soltera con un hijo que tiene la edad de 14 años,  La Sra. Dore se dedica a la venta de huevos en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la zona de Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Dore va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de huevo por mayor para aumento de su capital de trabajo, La Sra. Dore enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar los ingresos del negocio y va a utilizar los beneficios tener un mejor estilo de vida, La Sra. Dore es una persona trabajadora esta es la única actividad con que se mantiene y mantiene a su hijo, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dore is 45 years old and single and has a son who is 14 years old. Dore sells eggs in her neighborhood store, located in the Pampahasi zone. This will be her first loan cycle with this institution. Dore will use the loan to buy eggs at wholesale thereby augmenting her working capital.

Dore is facing up to the challenge of improving her business income. She will use these benefits to achieve a better style of life. 

Dore is a hard-working person and this is the only activity that provides support for her and her son. She feels happy and grateful to this institution for its offer of help.

loans.use: buy eggs at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is 32 years old and is happily married to Tima, who is a businesswoman. They have been blessed with 1 child. He is a shopkeeper and earns his living selling fish purchased from fisherman.  He makes the sales from his house. Salim would like to expand his business, and to have another shop in the outskirts of the city's wholesale market, because his products are in high demand by his customers.

Salim is asking for a loan so that he can buy more fish as it is in high demand and he would like to increase his stock.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Sehblay

texts.en:
Sehblay is 20 years old and lives in Buchanan in Ground Bassa County.  Buchanan is good at producing fish for the local Liberian market. She is single and has a two-year-old child that is in school and lives at home. 

For the past four years she has been selling slippers in the local market. She likes her business because it is quickly profitable. She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers for her business. She plans to  expand her business and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Sabins

texts.en:
Sabins is 48 years old.  A high school graduate, she is married and has three children between the ages of 19 and 31 years old, one of whom attends school.  Sabins' husband is an accountant.  The whole family lives in Margibi County, which is known for rubber production in Liberia. 

Sabins has been baking and selling bread for the local market.  She learned this way of selling from her friends.  She is requesting a loan to buy flour, yeast, baking powder, butter and oil to  expand her business.  She likes her business because a helper attends to her family and she hopes to have a new home.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, baking powder, butter and oil to  expand her business,

loans.name: Vardo

texts.en:
Vardo is 39 years old. He lives with his wife, two children and parents. Vardo’s mother is provided with a retirement pension. Vardo breeds cows and sheep and sells milk and milk products. He has ten years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how best to look after cattle. Selling milk and dairy products earns him 300 GEL per month.

He has requested a loan to purchase an additional milk cow and feed for his cattle. After the cattle are fed properly, they will produce lots of milk. The family will then be able to produce more dairy products and sell them for a good price. This will significantly increase the family income and will improve the living conditions for all members of the family. Vardo awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase an additional milk cow and feed for his cattle

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 37-year-old woman married to Edem, a 42-year-old trader. They both have three children. 

She has sold footwear for the past six years.  She gets her products from Makola and sells them to her customers in and around Dansoman.

This is her second loan and she needs an amount of GHS 700 to expand her business and to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi is seeking a subsequent loan after successfully repaying her previous loan. She is grateful that her prior loan helped her increase her income and living standards. She is now requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to buy sacks of maize to resell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize to resell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a 28-year-old divorced mother of two young children who are shown with her in the photograph.  Since her divorce, they have been living with her parents, who have been very supportive of them, in a rural village in the southeastern Albania. Agriculture/ livestock are seen as the only activities to help residents generate an income in this region, in addition to securing the basics for their families through such activities. Dairy is a staple food in all rural areas of Albania.

Juliana started her own activity about four years ago with the help from her parents, and now she wants to buy two more dairy cows in order to increase the dairy produce. She has been selling the milk to a nearby dairy farm.

The amount of loan she is requesting is 250,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: To add two more dairy cows to the existing herd

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 44 years old and married with five children between 2 and 17 years old. Francois has a shop in which he sells various goods such as soap, sugar, books, lotion, etc. He has been in business for ten years.

Francois has requested a loan from Vision Finance Company to purchase various goods such as soap, sugar, books, lotion and beans for resale. With his profits, he will be able to save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as soap, sugar, books, lotion and beans for resale.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort  is 30 years-old and live at Airport Community in Margibi County which is good at producing rubber for the Liberian  market.  She is married  with three children between 5 to 13 years-old. The children live at home and attend school.

For the past three years, she been selling  flour, sugar, rice, oil, etc. at the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learnt this way of selling from her mother. She appreciated her business because she earns some saving money every day and she has plans to build a house.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more flour, sugar, rice, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, rice, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 50 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 14 and 28.  They all live in Buchanan, Ground Bassa County, a city that is good at producing fish for the local Liberian market. She has not been fortunate enough to attend school in her life but she is good at managing a business. She has been involved in the sale of used clothes in the local market, having learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She likes her business because it helps her save money. With the additional income, she plans to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luis Javier

texts.es:
Luis nació en Guayaquil. El empezó con el hermano a trabajar arreglando tuberias  pero lastimosamente el hermano falleció y el cliente se quedo  a cargo de toda la cartera de clientes que ellos dos habian conseguido juntos. Para conseguir mas ingresos el comenzo con un negocio de un bazar-papeleria vendiendo cuadernos, plumas, hojas etc. 

Todos los dias el sale a trabajar dando los servicios de arreglado de tuberias y otras cosas de las casas de los clientes mientras que la esposa esta con el negocio del bazar atendiendo hasta que el llegue.

Está casado tiene tres hijos, su esposa atiende el bazar en el domicilio. Sus tres hijos estudian en una escuela fiscal.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar mercadería como cuadernos, plumas, papeleria. Las metas o sueños del cliente con este préstamo es poder incrementar más su negocio de bazar para así poder requerir más ayuda para los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis was born in Guayaquil. He and his brother began working by performing plumbing repairs. Unfortunately, his brother died and he was left in charge of all of the customers that they had acquired while working together. In order to earn more income, Luis started a bazaar and stationery shop where he sells notebooks, pens, sheets of paper, and other items.

Every day, he leaves for work so that he can provide plumbing services and perform other household jobs for his customers. His wife manages the bazaar until he returns home. Luis is married and has three children. His wife looks after the business in their home. Their three children attend a state school.

With this loan, Luis will buy merchandise such as notebooks, pens, and stationery. His goals and dreams include using this loan to expand his bazaar even more so that he can help with the household expenses and his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, and stationery.

loans.name: Jorgjeta

texts.en:
Jorgjeta is an Egyptian married mother. She has two school-aged children and two little ones. They all live in a main city as part of a vulnerable Egyptian community. 

Buying and selling second-hand items, particularly clothes, is something that Jorgjeta has been doing for the past almost ten years.  “Almost everyone in my community runs the same activity, and still, there is some profit for everyone,” Jorgjeta said. “With this income, I just secure the basics for my family and nothing further, yet, thank God. It’s a good feeling knowing that you have food on the table for your children,” she continued saying.

She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek for the first time to buy more of such items to resell.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 40 years old, and lives in the Airport community. She is a married high school graduate, and has three children between 12 and 22 years old, all of whom are in school, and only two live at home. For the past ten years she been selling rice, biscuits, vita, candy, oil, pepper and other goods. She started this business with a small amount from her husband after learning the business from her aunty. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business, and hopes to make more profit to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as rice, biscuits, vita, candy, oil and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward has been engaged in carpentry for more than 20 years. He is doing very well because he has a good reputation in the neighborhood for the good work he always does. As a result, he has been able to give his family everything they need for a decent life.

Edward is requesting another Kiva loan to buy tools for his workshop as well as more timber. He has great demand for his work, and through these purchases he will be able to provide better service and greater speed to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more timber and tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a single man of 25 years. He keeps pigs for sale and also owns a cyber cafe in Kawangware. He has been in these businesses for three years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 60,000.

This will be Antony's second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy feed for the pigs and five computers for the cyber cafe. He wants to be a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs and five computers

loans.name: Josefa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Josefa es una mujer ejemplar, preocupada por el bien estar de su familia, esforzada para apoyar en el mejoramiento de su casa y darles las condiciones más humanas  a su núcleo familiar, es casada con una hija la que le está proporcionando todo el apoyo para que se desarrolle académica mente.

Actualmente esta señora tiene la urgencia de ser favorecida con un financiamiento, por eso llego a las oficinas de ceprodel, para solicitar un prestamo, para comprar el material de construcción que requiere para efectuar su obra de mejoramiento mismo, como bloques, cemento, hierro, arena, alambre de amarre, zinc y mano de obra y de esta manera agradece por su buen gesto a ceprodel y a los inversionistas de kiva, por brindarle el apoyo oportuno y necesario a  los sectores más pobres.
texts.en:
Josefa is an exemplary women who is concerned with her family's well-being and works hard to help with their home improvements.  She wants to give her nuclear family more humane conditions.  Josefa is married and has one daughter, who she supports completely in her academic development. 

Josefa urgently needs to be lucky enough to get a loan, which is why she came to Ceprodel's offices.  She is requesting the loan to purchase the construction materials she needs to carry out her home improvements.  She needs blocks, cement, sand, mooring wire, zinc and laborers.  Josefa is grateful to Ceprodel for their kind gesture and to the Kiva investors for offering timely and needed aid to the poorest sectors.

loans.use: with the purchase of blocks, cement, iron, sand, mooring wire, zinc and labor.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en: Teresiah is 42 years old, a single mother of two children. She sells a variety of fruits which are in season. She has been in this business for twelve years and makes a monthly income of 50,000 KES. This will be Teresiah's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy oranges and apples to re-sell. In future she wants to expand her business and open a shop.

loans.use: To purchase apples and oranges to re-sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Mbajue Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Activas de Mbajue se encuentra en el ciclo 14° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan y apoyan para lograr un objetivo en común que es mejorar su calidad de vida. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde  4 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza y no tienen los medios necesarios.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Virina, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. Esta joven madre de familia  consciente de que solo con el trabajo y esfuerzo que uno haga se puede  lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia, ella entre el trabajo de empleada publica ahora ha incursionado en la venta de ropa interior y le va muy bien ya que  se hizo de muy buena clientela y está creciendo gradualmente.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropa interior, y así cumplir con pedidos de sus clientes y tener variedad para ofrecer a los nuevos.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Activas de Mbajue” is in its 14th loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members work and support one another in their common goal of improving their quality of life. The members took a poverty elimination survey and the results indicated that four of the members are below the poverty line and do not have the necessary resources.

One of the members is Sra. Virina. Her latest survey indicated that she is within a Level 2 poverty stage. This young mother is aware that work and effort are the only ways to achieve total success so that she can provide for her family’s welfare. Virina has a job as a public employee but now she has also started selling undergarments and is doing very well. She has built up a good clientele and is slowly growing.

Virina is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of undergarments. This will enable her to fulfill her customers’ orders and offer them a variety of new products.

loans.use: to buy undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is widowed with five children. Three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family (her sister and brother). She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for 10 years, selling to all categories of people on retail and is able to work from home.  

Joyce has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes and cooking oil. In addition to the restaurant business, she is also a peasant farmer. She works from her home seven days a week. 

Her major business challenge includes seasonality and ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas, cassava, cooking oil, beef, sweet and irish potatoes.

loans.name: Tee Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two partners residing at Dansoman. They are Francisca and Esther. They have been together since 2012 and are still doing very well. They both sell footwear.

Francisca, the leader, is a 35-year-old married woman. She is married to Kwabena, a 43-year-old trader. They have four children in school. 

She has been doing this for the past 3 years.  She was given 350 GHS as her first loan which she was able to repay accordingly. Through her dedication and seriousness in her business, she has been able to build up trust with ID Ghana, her second home. 
On her second loan she is requesting an amount of 700 GHS to help her boost her business and to satisfy her customers in and around her locality.

The two members together need 1,050 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more footwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo 35 years old and married. She has three children, ages 8, 10 and 15. She runs a retail shop in Mwambalazi, Kenya. She has been in this business for six years and sells soft drinks, pure water, sugar and variety of goods at her store. Her business is the only income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation and competition in the market.

Mlongo is requesting a loan amounting to KES 30,000 to buy different varieties of goods like soft drinks, pure water and sugar. She says that the extra income generated by use of this loan will help her to increase her business and take good care of her children. In the future, she would like to build a permanent business location. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of goods like soft drinks, pure water and sugar.

loans.name: Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bello Amanecer está conformado por nueve integrantes nueve mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país, y el lugar se caracteriza por ser un lugar productor de leche, cuajada, queso. Estas personas son trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación persona. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos ninguna pudo terminar sus estudios, por lo que vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad. Situación que no quieren para sus hijos por eso luchan, para brindarles mejores oportunidades.
Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante es que la coordinadora del banco comunal Bello amanecer es Juana Guillermina y tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en pequeñas cantidades como sobre de shampoo, sobre de café, pan, huevos, frijoles, azúcar, leche, arroz, aceite, tiste. Actividad que la desempeña con muchos gusto, ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. La rutina de trabaja de Juana es trabajar unas 12 horas ofreciendo su productos en su pulpería. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de consumo diario para el hogar. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Bello Amanecer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Bello Amanecer' [beautiful dawn] is made up of nine members - [eight] women and a man; fathers and mothers responsible for 20 children. They come from Sauce in the northern part of the country, a place characterized by milk, junket and cheese production. 

These people are hardworking, responsible and enthusiastic about self-improvement. Regrettably, due to a lack of economic resources, none of them could finish their studies as they were obliged to work from an early age. This is a situation they don't want for their children, so they fight to offer them better opportunities. 

Thanks to her spirit and desire to succeed, the coordinator of the 'Bello Amanecer' communal bank is Juana Guillermina. She works in a pulpería [grocery store] located in her home. A pulpería is a small shop that sells grocery products in small quantities like sachets of shampoo, packets of coffee, bread, eggs, beans, sugar, milk, rice, oil, and tiste [a soft drink made from toasted cornflour]. It's an activity that she very much enjoys doing since it has been her way of life and that of her family. 

Juana's work routine is to work about 12 hours offering products in her grocery store. The reason for the loan is to invest in business capital and supply her business in the buying and selling of daily- consumption products for the home, so that in the not-too-distant future she can obtain a better income. The Bello Amanecer communal bank thanks the Kiva investors for offering help to people with limited resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified job.

loans.use: to invest in business capital and supply her grocery store by buying grocery products like sachets of shampoo, packets of coffee, bread, eggs, beans, sugar, milk, rice, oil and tiste [a soft drink made from toasted cornflour]

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha, 35 years old, is married and lives in Msambweni. She owns her own home, which meets the basic conditions necessary for her to carry out her business activity in the heart of her family. Mwanasha also has her own clothing sales business.

Mwanasha has a small food market. She has been in business for 12 years and has the necessary infrastructure to carry out her work. Her products are very well known and very popular in her community.

Mwanasha is requesting this loan to invest in buying raw materials, mainly meat, milk and eggs. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the support they have offered her through this loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, mainly meat, milk and eggs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with ten children. She lives in her own home in Msambweni. She works hard and tirelessly to be able to give her children everything that they need to have a good life.

Fatuma has owned a food store for the past two years. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. This couple works hard for their family and they are asking for the opportunity to continue to grow. She anticipates an increase in demand in her food store. For this reason they want to have their business well stocked. They are grateful for the opportunity they are given since this will be of great help.

loans.use: to purchase inputs for the store.

loans.name: Alphunsina

texts.en:
Alphunsina is married with three children, and all of her three children go to school. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  

Alphunsina works at the market and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah, 41 years old, is married to Patrick and has two children. For the past 2 years, she has operated an M-Pesa business, a mobile-phone-based money-transfer service which allows users to deposit, withdraw, and transfer money, and pay bills, at very affordable rates without visiting a bank. Serah earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES from the business.

This will be Serah's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire amount to add to her business float. In the future, Serah plans to open another M-Pesa shop.

loans.use: To increase her M-pesa float

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread and cakes to sell.

loans.name: Mwaruwa

texts.en:
Mwaruwa is 55 years old, married and the father of four children. His children are 12, 15, 17 and 19 years old. He sells cattle and this is the only revenue that he earns for a living. He has been in this business for the last seven years. His major monthly expenditure is the payment of school fees for his children.

Mwaruwa has approached Yehu Microfinance with a loan request amounting to KES 50,000 to buy cattle during the season in which they are sold cheaply.

loans.use: to buy cattle during the season in which they are sold cheaply.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a single man of 39 years-old, he has one child.  He operates a taxi business in Kawangware and he has been in this business for six years now.  He earns a monthly income of 100,000 shillings.

This will be Peter's first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to do major maintenance for the taxi and to pay the insurance fee for the vehicle. In the future, he wants to be a very prominent business man.

loans.use: to buy insurance and service for his taxi.

loans.name: Jowe

texts.en:
Jowe is a single mother of four children, and all of her children go to school. She does not support additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for five years. 

Jowe has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works six days out of every week in a shop that she rents. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  

Jowe aspires to import used clothes and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman of 41 years and a mother of four children. She operates a cereal shop in Kangemi and has been in this business for four years now. She earns a monthly income of 100,000 shillings.

This will be Florence's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to buy ten sacks of beans and rice for sale. In the future, she wants to have a bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy ten sacks of beans and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her vehicle.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married and has four children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. For the past 4 years, Ruth has operated a business selling used clothes. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Ruth works at the market six days every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda.

Ruth has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She aspires to become a wholesaler, to educate her children up to university and to get enough profits to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms. Ruth resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Ruth's monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business at the market.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en: Maimuna is a 32-year-old married woman with two children. She describes herself as an honest woman. She operates a food stall where she sells coconuts. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within an urban area and her primary customers are hotels. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of a permanent business premise. She will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy coconuts to sell. Her business goal is to be a coconut distributor within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She also runs a grocery store where she sells items such as tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 49 years old and lives in Airport Community. She is married with four children aged between 7 and 27, only two live at home and attend school. For the past eight years she been running a table market where she sells rice, oil, pepper, salt, onion, batteries and others items in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband after learning this way of selling from her mother. She is appreciative of her business because it keeps her saving money every day and makes her popular. Her plan is to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, salt, onion, batteries and other items for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, salt, onion, batteries and other items for her business.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo is married with four children, and all of her children go to school. She has a business selling vegetables and has been in this business for three years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. 

Teo has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of cabbages, amaranth and tomatoes. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on wholesale only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

Teo aspires to grow amaranth and cabbages herself and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of cabbages,tomatoes and amaranth

loans.name: Tunu

texts.en:
Tunu, from Msambweni, is married and has one child. She is a hairdresser, and she also sells sewing supplies. She has loyal customers, because she always gives good service.

Tunu is a hardworking person, responsible and very honest. She started to work in a hair salon as customer care, and her dream was to become a professional with her own salon. With time, sacrifice and hard work she was able to reach her goal.

She is now requesting a loan to expand her beauty salon and in this way be able to continue growing and offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to expand her beauty salon.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 47 years old, married, with a three-year-old child who lives at home. She lives in the county which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. Her husband is a security guard. For the past ten years she has been selling biscuits, candy, fresh milk, bread and other items in the community market after learning this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items to sell in her business. She enjoys how supportive she is to her family. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, candy, fresh milk, bread and other items for her business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 44-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 6 months to 2 years. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located within a market place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds to expand the business. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 46 years old, married to Alice and a father of five children. He is a timber merchant and operates his business in Limuru town. He has been in this business for twelve years with a monthly income of 60,000 KES.

This will be David's sixth loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy a power saw. In the future he wants to be a wealthy businessman.

loans.use: To purchase a power saw.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is from Msambweni. She is a merchant and the owner of a food stall. She has been doing this work for years and she has become very well known among the customers who go there.

Faiza is a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead. That's why she works so hard. She works from very early in the morning to prepare the dishes she sells, and she returns home late at night.

She is requesting this loan to buy beverages and supplies for her food stall. This is what she most needs and uses every day.

She's grateful for this opportunity because with it she's making progress.

loans.use: to buy beverages and supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en: Fanta is 32 years old and lives in Margibi county which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. Unfortunately she did not attend school. She has been involved in business for the past twenty years. She is married and has three children between 10 to 21 years old, only one lives with her and goes to school. Her husband worked with Firestone. She is requesting a loan to purchase cold water and soft drinks for her business. She hopes to build a house for herself and children.

loans.use: to purchase cold water and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of four additional family members (sisters and elderly parents). She has a business selling used shoes and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 400000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works at the market and sells to all categories of people. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university level. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly, a married mother of two children, both of whom go to school, also takes care of her elder sister's children. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

For the past year, Milly has operated a business selling charcoal, working at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She has applied for a loan of 400000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Milly aspires to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to facilitate transportation.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Piedad Amabilia

texts.es:
Piedad nació en Guayaquil, tiene 52 años. Comenzó hace 10 años (2003) trabajando en una empresa distribuidora de productos lácteos, pero con un préstamo familiar, decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de víveres y abarrotes, poco a poco creció su negocio; en la actualidad posee una tienda bien reconocida en el sector de donde vive.

Piedad trabaja desde las 6:30 de la mañana, va al mercado a comprar los productos frescos para la comercialización de su tienda. No ha tenido dificultades en su negocio y con la ayuda de Dios va progresando día a día. Esta soltera, tiene tres hijos todos son mayores de edad y viven independiente.

Con el préstamo requiere poder comprar arroz, azucar, granos, enlatados etc. En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para poder realizar la compra de sus productos con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Piedad was born in Guayaquil and is 52 years of age. Ten years ago (in 2003), she began working for a distribution company that sells dairy products. With a loan she received from a relative, Piedad decided to establish her own business of selling food and groceries. Her business slowly grew over time. At the moment, she has a store that is well-known in the area where she lives. Piedad begins her work at 6:30 A.M. She goes to the market to buy fresh products that she will sell in her store. Piedad has not encountered any difficulties with her business and with the help of God she steadily makes progress day after day. She is single and all three of her children are grown and live independently.

With this loan, Piedad wants to buy rice, sugar, grains, canned goods, and other items. In the future, she would like to buy a truck so that she can buy her products with greater ease.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El señor Edwin tiene 28 años, es técnico eléctrico, su taller lo tiene ubicado en localidad de El Torno ahí brinda servicio técnico en reparación y cableado de todo tipo de aparatos eléctricos, ahora el crédito que solicita es para la compra de repuestos y materiales para su trabajo ya que tiene un contrato de instalación de luz den un edificio de la ciudad de Santa Cruz y necesita el dinero para este trabajo, El Sr. Edwin es una persona joven emprendedora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Edwin is 28 years old, works as an electrician and his workshop is located in the town of El Torno. There, he provides technical service in all kinds of repairs and wiring in all types of electrical appliances. 

The loan he is requesting now is to buy spare parts and materials for his work, because he has a contract to install light in a building located in the city of Santa Cruz. He needs the money for this work. Edwin is a young entrepreneur who is happy and grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and electric material

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself as committed. He operates a farm stand where he sells vegetables such as tomatoes and kale. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer. His business goal is to be a vegetable distributor within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy kale and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Sarli

texts.es:
Sarli, de 29 años de edad, esta casada con Edson quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus hijos gemelos de 05 años de edad . Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa el cual es fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación.La actividad que realiza Sarli es la venta de pollos beneficiados, para eso se levanta todos los días muy de temprano y se dirige a los puertos donde llegan los productores de los caseríos y les compra los pollos  a precios por mayor, luego los lleva a su puesto de venta en el mercado donde los vende al por menor, Se inició en éste negocio hace más de 02 años con un capital propio,considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y que le han servido para solventar los gastos de su hogar. 
Este será el préstamo número 03 con MFP y está agradecida al saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para continuar con su negocio por esta razón el monto solicitado es de 800 nuevos soles los cuales  invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, como pollos en mayor cantidad, buscando precios cómodos para sus compras en volumen y asi tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sarli, 29, is married to Edson who works in transportation and is the father of their five-year-old twins.  They live comfortably in their house which is the fruit of their labor and dedication.  Sarli’s activity is selling butchered chickens.  To do so, she rises very early every day and heads out to the ports where products come in from the settlements and she buys the chickens at wholesale and then takes them to resell them at retail in her stand.  She started her business over two years ago with her own capital.  She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the good profits it nets that she’s used to cover her household expenses.

This will be MFP loan #3 and she’s grateful to know that she’ll be able to rely on financial help to stay in business.  She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy merchandise like chickens in larger amounts for her business seeking the best prices for volume purchases so her income will be higher.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 1 year to 18 years. She describes herself as independent. She operates a retail stall where she sells items such as soap, sugar, steel wire, cereals, sweets, flour, cooking fat and rice. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a competitive market  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy household items to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: La Sra. Deysi tiene 43 años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 14 y 15 años, ella se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya varios años ella confecciona ropa de tela polar , su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona de Santa Rosa. Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Deysi va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas polar para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión. La Sra. Deysi enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes. , La Sra. Deysies una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Deysi, 43, is married and has two children who re 14 and 15 years of age.  She’s been working making clothes for several years now; she makes clothes out of fleece and her workshop is located at home which is located in the Santa Rosa zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Deysi will use it to buy fleece to manufacture clothing at wholesale.  Her reason for requesting the present loan is to increase her investment capital.  The business challenge Deysi faces is increasing income and she will use profits to buy supplies to make good quality clothes so she can get more customer orders.  Deysi’s a very hardworking person and she feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy fleece.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, está casada, reside  en compañía de su familia en una comunidad del Municipio de Taulabe, Departamento de Comayagua.

Doña María inicio su negocio de venta de golosinas y alimentos preparados por ella misma. 

Ella vende Pastelitos de carne, tortillas con quesillo, baleadas, refrescos, dulces, galletas y churros.

Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de refrescos, golosinas, verduras, manteca, maseca, harina de trigo, lácteos y carne de pollo.
Ella espera aumentar sus ventas y así mejorar sus ingresos para tener una mejor vida junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 48, has two children.  She’s married and lives with her family in a community in the municipality of Taulabe, Comayagua Department.  María’s business is selling snacks and food she makes herself.  She sells meat pies, tortillas with string cheese, ‘baleadas’ [thick flour tortillas filled with eggs, beans and other ingredients], soft-drinks, candy, cookies and packaged snacks.  

She’s currently asking for a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy soft-drinks, snacks, vegetables, lard, Maseca [corn flour], wheat flour, dairy products and chicken.  She hopes to increase sales and improve her income in order to have a better life with her children.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, snacks, vegetables, lard, Maseca, flour, dairy products and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more wax-prints and sell to customers

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a single mother of six children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used shoes and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She works at the market, works seven days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start importing used shoes. She resides in her own house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Juan De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene 53 años de edad, es acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos. Él se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura, desde que era un niño; aprendió la actividad de su padre, quien cultivaba maíz, fríjol, maicillo y actualmente le esta apostando al cultivo de plátano. Ese cultivo le esta generando buena producción, debido a que el terreno es bastante fértil. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, viaja a la ciudad que esta a unos 5.3 kilómetros de su casa, el recorrido lo realiza en transporte publico. La cosecha las comercializa con habitantes de la zona, y en el mercado municipal. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para ampliar su producción de plátanos y brindarle la fertilización adecuada. Para aprovechar una parte del terreno que tiene disponible y es fértil para el cultivo de plátano. Su propósito, es conseguir más ingresos para mejorar su vivienda; ya que una parte es de adobe y la otra de madera; entonces desea cerrarla completamente de adobe, ya que en invierno se moja dentro de la casa.  Entre sus sueños, está construir su casa de bloque con cuatro habitaciones separadas, ya que la que tiene está dividida por carpetas plásticas y cartón y es de adobe con madera. Además, quiere sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de plátano; actualmente solo siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados. Otro sueño es de enviar a su hija al bachillerato para que asista a la universidad.
texts.en:
Juan, 53, has a spouse and four children.  He’s worked in agriculture since he was a boy having learned from his father who grew corn, beans and sorghum; he's currently betting on banana growing.  This crop is generating good yields because his land is quite fertile.  In order to buy his farm supplies he travels to a city that’s 5.3 kilometers away from his house, a trip he makes in public transportation.  He sells his harvests to local residents and in the municipal market.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to increase banana production and to provide proper fertilization to take advantage of part of the land he has available that’s fertile and apt for growing bananas.  His goal is to earn more income to do some home improvements because part of it is adobe and part is wood and he’d like it to be completely adobe because the interior gets wet in winter.

Among his dreams is to build a brick house with four separate bedrooms since his current house is divided by plastic sheets and cardboard and it’s made of adobe and wood.  He also wants to plant 14,000 square meters of bananas; he currently only plants 7,000 square meters.  His other dream is to send his daughter to high-school so she can then attend university.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La Sra. Tomasa de 41 años, está comprometida con el Sr. Anibal de 40 años, ellos tiñen 6 hijos que están estudiando, cada uno según su edad. Tomasa y su esposo se esfuerzan al máximo por dar a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan para estudiar y el día de mañana ser personas de bien y honestas.
Doña Tomasa, como la conocen, ella es costurera, se inició en esta profesión hace más de 16 años,   aproximadamente desde el año: 1.996, ellos comenzaron con un capital que trajeron del vecino país Argentina, donde estaban trabajando, actualmente ellos tienen un negocio donde fabrican ropas deportivas para instituciones estudiantiles y deportivas, con su trayectoria ellos se ganaron muchos clientes, que le visitan en su domicilio mismo para hacer sus pedidos.
 Este crédito le servirá para comprar más  insumos al por mayor como: (telas de diferentes colores y tipo, hijos, botones y cierres) y con esto podrán seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Tomasa is 41 years old and married to Sr. Anibal, age 40. They have six children who are in school, all of whom are enrolled in a grade based on their age. Tomasa and her husband do their best to give their children everything need for their studies so that one day they can become successful and honest people.

Doña Tomasa is known as a seamstress. She started in this profession more than 16 years ago around 1996. Tomasa started out with some capital that she earned while working in the neighboring country of Argentina. Now she has a business where she produces sportswear for educational institutions and sports clubs. Throughout her career, she has gained many customers who visit her home in order to place their orders.

This loan will be used to buy more supplies in bulk such as fabrics of different types and colors, thread, buttons, and zippers. As a result, she will be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and zippers.

loans.name: Ovidio Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ovidio tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, reside en una comunidad  del Municipio de La Másica, Departamento de Atlántida.
Ovidio se dedica a la venta de alimentos a través de una pulpería desde hace 3 años. 
El decidió establecer este negocio debido a la falta de empleo, anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajo de jornalero en haciendas de ganado vacuno.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de medicamentos analgésicos, maíz, fríjoles, arroz, manteca, pan, condimentos, productos de aseo y limpieza, refrescos y golosinas.

El espera seguir creciendo en su negocio ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Ovidio, 33, is single living in a community in the municipality of La Másica, Atlántida Department.  He works selling foodstuffs in a grocery store he’s had for three years.  He decided to start this business due to the lack of employment; he used to work as a day laborer on cattle ranches.  He’s currently asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy analgesics, corn, beans, rice, lard, bread, condiments, cleaning and hygiene supplies, soft-drinks and snacks.  He hopes to continue growing in business offering a wider variety of goods in order to improve profits.

loans.use: to buy analgesics, corn, beans, rice, lard, bread, condiments, cleaning supplies, soft-drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 35 years old and lives in Margibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She lives with her husband and four children. All her children are in school and are between 10 to 16 years old. For 20 years now, she has been involved with business in the market. Her aunt taught her how to sell and assisted her with 500 LRD. By this means, she was able to establish her business. Four years ago now, she started selling fresh fish in the market. She makes more profit and has more customers. She is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for her business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, a married mother of three children, two of whom go to school, resides in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Aisha has a business selling motorcycle spare parts. She works seven days a week in a shop that she rents, and her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 400000 from MCDTSACCO to buy more motorcycle spare parts.

Aisha aspires to own a fully stocked shop selling motorcycle spare parts and also to build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto  tiene 25 años y es soltero  se dedica a la venta de desayunos ella vende te, mates, y arroz con leche y  sándwich  y otros en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado en la  zona de Pampa de la Isla ,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Roberto  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de un carrito hamburguesero para la elaboración de hamburguesas y así brindar variedad de alimentos a sus clientes,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este carrito necesario para su negocio, El Sr. Roberto  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia que tiene en el mercado  en la venta de desayuno y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir incrementando su capital de trabajo y mejora de su puesto, su deseo para su negocio es tratar de comprar otro puesto y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Roberto, 25, is single.  He makes a living selling breakfast.  He sells tea, yerba mate, rice pudding, sandwiches, and other things in a sales stall in the Pampa de la Isla area.

This is Roberto's first loan sequence with the institution.  He's going to use it to buy a hamburger cart to make hamburgers and bring a variety of food to his customers.  He's requesting this loan because he lacks the capital to buy the cart he needs for his business.

The challenge Roberto faces in his business is the competition selling breakfast in the market.

He's going to use the profits to continue increasing his working capital and improve his stall.  His desire for his business is to try to buy another stall and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a hamburger cart

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is married with eight children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 15 years, selling to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of  300,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through selling piped water and from rental rooms. She works at the market five days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to  become a wholesaler and also to get enough profits so as to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is 57 years old. He is married with seven children, three of whom attend school. He also takes care of two grandsons. Willy has a printing and stationery business on Rubaga road ‘A’ zone that he started in 1995 in order to stimulate his income with an aim of looking after his family.

Willy’s challenges are limited capital to meet his clients' demands (his clients, in turn, leave him as he cannot supply them in time), competition from other service providers, and low returns to enable him to take care of his family well and again grow his business. Willy’s customers are schools, offices, customers with party functions, and many others.

Willy wants the loan to add to his business to enable him to meet his clients' demands and to improve his returns so that he can see his children finish up school since he is aging up.

Willy is a hard-working old man who loves development. He is confident that the partnership he has started with UGAFODE will go a long way. He is excited that he will be able to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy printing papers

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: Monsieur Lamine réside au Sénégal. Il  est célibataire et exerce l’activité de commerce depuis  plus de 10 ans pour subvenir a ses besoins  personnels et  en même  temps assister ses parents. Il pratique la   vente de pièces  détachées depuis plus de 10 ans. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de prendre  en charge sa location et sa nourriture quotidienne. Il démarre sa journée de travail à 9 heures pour renter à 19 heures. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou il a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de pièces détachées en vue de renforcer son stock. Son objectif est d’accroitre davantage ses bénéfices afin de pouvoir mieux se prendre en charge et accroitre son fond de roulement. Son projet dans le futur consiste a acquérir des magasins de pièces détachées un peu partout dans la capital.
texts.en: Mr. Lamine lives in Senegal. He is single and has been in business for over 10 years in order to support himself and also help out his parents. He has been selling spare parts for over 10 years. The revenues from his business allow him to take care of his rent and food expenses. He starts his working day at 9 AM and finishes at 7 PM. He is a member of a branch of UIMCEC and has already repaid two prior loans. He is seeking a loan of 500,000 West African francs intended to buy spare parts and reinforce his stock. His goal is to increase his revenues in order to be able to better provide for his needs and bolster his working capital. His future plans include opening stores of spare parts in different areas of the capital.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Kazi Bora Group

texts.en:
Kazi Bora is a group of 24 farmers in Kakamega South District, represented by Samwel. The group has 19 women and 5 men. Samwel is on the right of the photo, with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit, consisting of materials sufficient to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Samwel first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains, and now he is preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Samwel joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to use his increased profits to send his children to school.

Samwel described his last year's harvest as very good, but he believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the expected profits from the harvest to send his children to school and to repair his home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. In total, Kazi Bora group will receive 12 acres' worth of inputs, on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагуль 54 года, мать 3 детей. Айнагуль в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1989 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня в хозяйстве Айнагуль насчитывается 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 2 коровы, 2 лошадь. Ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнагуль обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 телят. Доходы от кредита Айнагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса. Мечтает купить дом в Бишкеке.
texts.en: Ainagul is a 54-year-old mother of three.  She is also the main source of income for her family.  Since 1989, she has worked with livestock.  She started her business with 15,000 KGS and now has ten young cattle, two cows, and two horses.  Her monthly income from the sale of milk and other dairy products is around 5,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, Ainagul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy three calves.  She plans to reinvest the additional profits from the loan back into her business.  She also dreams of buying a home in Bishkek

loans.use: To purchase 3 calves.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 28 years old and married to Agnes, and they have been blessed with one child, who is 3 years old. John sells phone accessories and engages in M-PESA electronic money transfer business. He has been in business for seven years and earns a monthly income of KES 65,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 50,000. With the loan he plans to add to his stock of phone accessories and add some float to his M-PESA business.

John plans to pay back the loan with the anticipated profit from the business. This is his first loan. His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase phone accesories and add float to the M-PESA business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 30 years old and lives in Margibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, with her boyfriend and three children. All their children are in school and between the ages of seven to seventeen years old. For eight years now she has been selling drinks, beer, stout, white spirit gin, and black horse gin at her shop in her community. She started her business with money given to her by her boyfriend; to make more profit and have more customers, she is requesting a loan to buy more soft drinks, beer, stout, white spirit gin, and black horse gin for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for her business

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is 39 years old, married, and supports seven members of the family. She runs a beauty salon and she has been in business for ten years. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 10,000. She is borrowing a loan of loan of KES 52,000, which she plans to use to purchase a blow dryer, dryer, and to expand her business. She plans to use the anticipated profits from the business to buy more cosmetics. She successfully paid her previous loan. Priscilla's hope and dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a dryer and blow dryer for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is made up of two partners, namely Mary and Mary, who reside in Mpoase in Dansoman. They have been as a group for 3 years now and are doing very well. Both sell bags and provisions.

Mary is a 38-year-old bag seller. This has been her work for the past 6 years and she is doing very well. Because of her integrity and frankness, all her customers have her at heart. She has been with ID Ghana for the past 3 years and still loves to be part of us.

She has taken 5 loans and has fully repaid them all. On her sixth loan, Mary is requesting GHS 1,500 to help her meet her customers' demands. 

The group needs an amount of GHS 2,300 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in and around Dansoman.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell to customers

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: La Sra. Eulalia  tiene 40 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 11 años que se encuentran en edad escolar,  ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de jugos de naranja, mandarina  y de papaya  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Eulalia  va a usar este préstamo para la compra  de insumos como  azúcar y frutas que compra al por mayor para la elaboración de sus jugos,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo,  La Sra. Eulalia  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 40 years old and has two children, aged eight and 11 years old, who are in school age. She sells a variety of juices, such as orange, tangerine, and papaya juice in her stall located in the town of El Torno. 

This loan is her first sequence within the institution. Eulalia will use this loan to buy ingredients such as sugar and fruits, which she buys in bulk to elaborate the juices. The reason to request this loan is the lack of cash. Eulalia is a hardworking person and is happy for the opportunity given because this is the only activity that allows her to support herself.

loans.use: to buy sugar and fruits

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Spartak is a 25-year-old, hard-working Roma man. He is married and lives with his extended family in the suburbs. People in his community have made positive comments about him!

For the past five years, Spartak has been doing seasonal construction work in Greece, and selling used items in the local market of his city, as well. Since there was not much construction work anymore in Greece, he began to practice the trade in his home city, and he enjoys it equally. However, his attention is mostly in buying and selling second-hand items, according to him. Spartak needs a loan now, to stock up on used items to resell.

loans.use: To build up an inventory of used items to resell

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama is 29 years old and lives in Margibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, with her boyfriend and four children. All of their children are in school and between the ages of five to fifteen years old. For ten years now she has been selling soft drinks, beer, stout, white spirit gin, and black horse gin at her shop in the local market. She started her business by selling for her mother; she enjoys the profits she makes everyday and the response of her customers. Mama is requesting a loan to purchase more white spirit gin, soft drinks, beer, stout, and black horse gin for her business. She plans to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks for her business

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a widow, aged 40, and from Sanga village in the Kiruhura district. Her husband died ten years ago in a bus accident, which claimed many lives along the Kampala highway. After her husband’s death, life became miserable to the extent that Doreen could not afford tuition for her fatherless children. The situation worsened when her father-in-law tried to marry her and when she refused, he took all the cows her husband left her with. Because of the situation, she started up a food stall in the market with a little capital acquired from her mother to enable her to look after her family. However, this business has not been doing well because of inadequate capital and yet Doreen still has to meet all her family's needs. It is with this background that she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings to add capital to her business so she can increase her income for the survival of her family.

loans.use: to buy food items for selling

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 41 años, es madre  soltera.  cuenta con una casa propia y vive junto a su hijo de 03 años a quien quiere brindarle una buena educacion.EL trabajo de Lucy, consiste en la venta de productos por catalogo tales como cosmèticos, perfumes y ropa , este trabajo lo realiza desde su vivienda donde instalo un pequeño local en el cual exhibe sus diferentes productos. También sale a las calles ofrece y reparte su mercadería entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, lleva mas de tres años en esta actividad . Se inicio en esta labor ya que no tenia el apoyo económico para la crianza de  su hijo por ello decidió salir adelante poniendo su propio negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite  tener tiempo para su hogar y al mismo tiempo generar sus propios  ingresos , más adelante espera  comprar una vitrina donde pueda mostrar sus productos por esta razón solicita 2500 soles para comprar productos  novedosos  tales como perfumes, ropa para niños, damas y caballeros y asi dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucy, 41 years old, is a single mother and has her own house where she lives with her three year old son. She would like to provide her son with a good education. Lucy works selling catalogue items such as cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing, and she does this from her home where she has installed a small locale from which she exhibits her different products. She also goes out to the streets to sell her goods, and makes sales among her friends, neighbors, and family. 

Lucy has been dedicating herself to this work for more than three years. She began doing this when she did not have enough resources to support her son, and in order to get ahead and provide for him decided to open her own business. What she likes about the job is that it allows her to have time to take care of her home, and at the same time generate her own income. In the future, she would like to buy a showcase where she can display her products, and for this reason she is asking for the loan of 2,500 Soles (Peruvian currency). This way, she will be able to buy new products such as perfume as well as clothes for men, women and children, therefore giving her clients better service.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and clothes

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 35 years old, married, and has been blessed with two children, ages 2 and 8 years. Jonah sells herbal products. He has been in business for three years, and right now his monthly income is KES 30,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 60,000. He intends to use this amount to purchase more herbal products to resell.  He will obtain the products both locally, and from outside the country. 

He plans to open another branch of his business, with the anticipated profit. His dream is to progress with his business, not only in Kenya, but also internationally.

loans.use: To purchase more herbal products for resale

loans.name: Alicia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 37 años de edad, esta acompañada  y tiene tres hijos.  Vive junto a su compañero de vida, tres hijos de ella y uno de él. Su esposo trabaja como payaso en los circos y ella posee una pequeña tienda en la laguna, siempre se ha dedicado a esa actividad; pues su mamá de eso trabaja. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más materia prima para elaborar la venta de yuca frita, tostadas de plátano, pastelitos, etc. ya que en esta época hay muchos turistas en la zona y sus ventas se duplican. Con las ganancias espera construir un cafetín a la orilla de la laguna. Su deseo, es reparar su casa poniéndole ladrillo al piso.
texts.en:
Alicia is 37 years old and has three children. She lives with her husband, who also has one child. Her husband works as a circus clown and Alicia has a small store. She has always worked in the store as this is what her mother did as well. 

The loan that she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy the ingredients to make fried yuca, plantains, pastries, etc., as this time of the year there are many tourists in the area where she works.
