With the income she makes from the sale of these food items, she hopes to open a more formal cafe on the shores of a nearby lagoon. Her wish is also to repair her house, by covering the floor with bricks.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make fried yuca, plantains, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 51 years old, married, and supports ten members of her family. She is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for two years. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 10,000.

Rael is borrowing a loan of KES 32,000, which she intends to use to purchase another dairy cow. She will use the anticipated profits from the business to educate her child.

This is her third loan and she successfully paid back her previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a 41-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from one year to ten years. He describes himself to be a humble, caring, and understanding man. Joel operates a retail business where he sells clothes; he has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital for expanding the business. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. His business goal is to run a boutique within five years. This is Joel's first loan with SMEP DTM. Joel also does farming, which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 30-year-old gentleman, who supports his siblings and elderly parents. He is a livestock trader in the Narok area. He has been in business for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

He has borrowed his third loan from KADET LTD, in the amount of KES 50,000. He intends to use it to purchase more livestock for fattening and later sale at a profit. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested in the business. His dream is to improve his living standard in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to fatten, and sell later at a profit

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man, who has two children. He describes himself as a humble man.  He operates a retail business, selling bread. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a business area with potential, and his customers are primarily local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is stiff competition in the area. He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy bread to sell. He aspires to be a great businessman.

loans.use: to buy bread to sell

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fe y Esperanza está conformado por 12 integrantes, todas madres solteras, con 28 hijos bajos su responsabilidad, originarias del Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente ninguna pudo cursar una carrera, por falta de recursos económicos. Se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde muy temprana edad. Por eso luchan duro en la vida para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Magali  mercedes es la coordinadora del banco comunal Fe y Esperanza, la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de los pagos en tiempo y forma. Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor es que tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como: sobre de  café , sobre de shampoo, sobre de salsa de tomate, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, pan, leche, huevos, detergentes, pasta dental, hielo, refresco naturales, tiste.  La rutina diaria de Magali es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles; para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Fe y Esperanza agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les ofrecen a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope) communal bank is made up of 12 members, all of whom are single mothers who care for a total of 28 children. They are natives of Malpaisillo, a place located in the western region of the country. These women are described as hard-working, responsible, and ambitious. Sadly, none of them were able to study because of a lack of funds. They saw themselves obligated to work from an early age. For this reason, they are working hard in life to give their children better lives.

Magali Mercedes is the communal bank Fe y Esperanza's coordinator. She is charge of payment accountability with regards to time and method. Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit she has the "pulpería" located in her home. A "pulpería" is a small store that sells foodstuffs and in small quantities things like: coffee packets, shampoo packets, tomato sauce packets, sugar, rice, beans, oil, bread, milk, eggs, detergents, toothpaste, ice, "natural" sodas, and tiste.

Magali's daily routine is to work 10 hours offering her products. The goal of this loan is to invest it in her work and stock her business with foodstuffs. This way, she may be able to improve her earnings in a not-so-distant future.

The communal bank Fe y Esperanza is grateful for the help that Kiva's lenders give to people with few resources and to other poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a better life.

loans.use: to invest money in their work and stock their grocery with foodstuffs such as coffee packets, shampoo packets, tomato sauce packets, sugar, rice, beans, oil, bread, milk, eggs, detergent, toothpaste, ice, "natural" sodas, and tiste.

loans.name: Pat's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three partners: Patience, Ruby and Olyvia. They have been a group since 2011. They sell school uniforms, cook food, and sell beverages, respectively.

Patience is a 47-year-old school uniform trader. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and is doing very well with her business.

She has been in this business for two years now. She is grateful to ID Ghana for the training on savings, which motivated her to save to achieve her dream. 

This is her fourth loan, and she needs GHS 600 to buy more uniforms to sell to her customers.  

Patience, Ruby, and Olyvia need a total amount of GHS 1,900 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more school uniforms to sell

loans.name: Nidia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Nidia del Socorro, trabajadora, y emprendedora, su negocio venta de cosméticos, ella vende de manera ambulante, tiene sus clientes fijos a los cuales les da crédito y lo recupera de forma quincenal, se observa  en la foto, ella con su cuaderno de cuentas por cobrar.

 Solicita el  préstamo a ceprodel para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra de cosméticos. Esto con el propósito de comprar más productos, ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes y captar más compradores.

  Agradece  a  ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su negocio  de forma que esto le permitirá llevar el sustento a su hogar  e ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Nidia del Socorro is hardworking and entrepreneurial, and she works selling cosmetics. She sells from door to door and has her established clients who she sells to on credit. She recoups the money clients own her every 15 days, and as you can see in the photo she keeps a notebook with her accounts receivable in order to keep track of everything. 

She is asking for this loan from Ceprodel in order to invest in working capital - specifically to buy cosmetics. By buying more products, she will be able to increase the variety she offers to clients and therefore gain more business. 

Nidia appreciates Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and confidence they have given her. She will invest this loan in her business in order to continue sustaining her home, and continue improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es: Don Fidel tiene 63 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos. Él desde muy pequeño empezó a trabajar en la agricultura, su padre fue quien le enseño. El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para mejorar su vivienda y para instalar la energía eléctrica en su casa. Lo que desea es dejarles una casa a sus hijos, que reúna todas las condiciones para que puedan desenvolverse mejor y que puedan realizar sus tareas escolares con la energía eléctrica.
texts.en: Don Fidel is 63 years old and has five children. Ever since he was a young man he has worked in agriculture, and his father is the one who taught him how to do this work. The loan that he is asking for from Fundación Campo is to improve his home and install electric energy in his house. He wants to leave the house for his children, and is working to improve all of the conditions to give it to them in better shape. He wants to install electric energy as it will make it easier for his children to complete their schoolwork.

loans.use: to improve his home and install electric energy

loans.name: Las Ovejas De Cristo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal las ovejas de cristo está conformado por 9 integrantes, siete mujeres y dos hombre, madres y padres con familias, bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de  Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracterizan por ser personas, trabajadoras, responsables, que han luchado duro en la vida por salir adelante, lamentablemente ninguno de ellos pudo cursar una carrera, por falta de recursos económicos, se vieron  obligados   a trabajar desde muy temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Por lo cual quieren brindar un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Reyna Elizabeth es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de las responsabilidades de pagos de cada integrante, y gracias a su esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuaja de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. La rutina de Reyna es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias, ofreciendo su cuajada con una pana en la cabeza de unos 20 kg, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de sus hijos.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo para comprar más materia prima como la  leche, bolsas plásticas, pastillas de cuajar  para  elaborar las cuajadas; para que en un futuro no muy lejano poder obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal las ovejas de cristo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener  fuentes de trabajo dignas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Ovejas de Cristo" (Christ's sheep) is formed by 9 members - 7 women and 2 men, mothers and fathers. These members are from Malpaisillo, a community located in the western region of the country characterized by its hardworking and responsible people who have fought hard to get ahead in life. Unfortunately, none of the members of this group were able to complete their studies for lack of resources that forced them to work from a very early age. Now, they are all working hard to provide a better future for their children. 

Reyna Elizabeth is the coordinator of the communal bank, and she is responsible for the repayments of each member. Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, her main work is the sale of milk products, which she does door to door and also from a room in her house. Reyna's routine is to work 10 hours a day, work that she performs with much pleasure as it has been able to support her and her children. The goal of this loan is to invest in more ingredients such as milk and plastic bags; in the near future she would like to improve her income. 

The communal bank "Las Ovejas de Cristo" appreciates the support that Kiva investors bring to people with scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua. It enables them to improve their businesses, work, and have their own dignified sources of income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as milk, milk products, and plastic bags

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 27 years of age and has a grocery store in Emali, where she sells tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and fruits. She also sells cereals, such as rice and beans. She is a single mother of two school-aged children.

This is her first loan, and she plans to use the loan to buy more tomatoes, oranges, and mangos to sell. She also plans to buy more potatoes and beans. She anticipates to make more money, with which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business by adding a greater variety of grocery items; thereby, she will make more money and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and fruits

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en: Ayub is a 45-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be a humble man. He operates a retail business where he sells car batteries, battery water, etc. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located within a high-traffic area, and his primary customers are the local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy batteries to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy batteries

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 29 years old and married. They have been blessed with three children now of the following ages: 6 years, 2 years and 4 months, respectively. He runs a business of selling used tires, and he has been in business for 10 years. His monthly income is 25,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

He is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000 with which he plans to purchase more tires to sell. This is his second loan, and he successfully paid his previous loans well and in good time.

loans.use: To purchase more tires to sell.

loans.name: Jerica

texts.en:
Jerica is a 53-year-old woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a humble woman. She operates a rental housing business where she provides housing services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located within a potential business area, and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds for improving the business. She will use the 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to pay for the renovation of the rental houses. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of 20,000 KES, which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the rental houses.

loans.name: Edemi

texts.en:
Edemi is 58 years old and from the small village of Chkhorotsku district. He has a large family: a wife, two sons, two daughters-in-law and a granddaughter. His wife is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two pigs, three goats, 10 milk cows and seven calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Besides this, they have a plot of agricultural land where 800 nut trees are grown. 

Edemi is a very hardworking man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow and calves. After purchasing additional cattle, they will produce more dairy products sell. This will increase their income, and they will be able to improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and calves.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is applying for another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost his furniture shop. He is applying for this loan to invest in various tools such as drills, emery, spanners, and so on. This loan will let him invest in his only source of income.

loans.use: To invest in various tools such as drills, emery, spanners, etc.

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
Albino age 60, a cacao farmer of 31 years, is from the Mayan village of San Jose. Albino and his wife Herminia have brought up 11 children, two of which are currently in high school. His wife Herminia stays home to take care of the children while Albino is on the farm. 

Apart from cacao, the family also plants corn, rice, cassava and other root veggies for home use. “Cacao farming is good because after three years of planting I started to harvest” says Albino. Besides cacao, his main source of income, Albino also plants peanuts for sale in the local market.

Albino got into cacao farming at the same time of a new market for cacao introduced by the local coop.  Albino’s favorite part of cacao farming is harvesting because it is the easiest task concerning cacao and is done under the shade of cacao and timber trees. “The challenging part for me is the cleaning, because it has to be done every three months,” says Albino.

The family is requesting the loan to clean their cacao farm and the surroundings. Cleaning is the process of removing the underbrush to open airflow in the field and so that it could be accessible for harvest. Cacao trees require shade, so they are grown literally in the jungle, making cleaning a necessary ingredient for its cultivation.

loans.use: To clean six acres of cacao farm

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, age 44, is from the beautiful village of Santa Ana, where he’s starting the second harvest from his six-year-old trees. Santa Anna is on the Moho River, which originates in Guatemala and passes through the village. Thomas, a farmer by vocation, cultivates the traditional package of corn, rice and beans for home use, and got involved in cacao six years ago inspired by a stable and booming market for organic cacao. 
His wife Josephina accompanies Thomas to the farm during harvesting time. Thomas and Josephina brought up seven children, age five to 23. For Thomas, cacao is among the best crops to invest in to have a secure source of income for the future. “My favorite part of cacao is harvesting because all I have to do is walk and pick the ripe pods,” says Thomas. He finds pruning to be the most challenging part of cacao farming as it requires a lot of lone time spent on the farm, hence his interest in hiring help with the process. 
Thomas is requesting the loan to hire help with the routine cleaning and pruning. Cleaning is the process of removing overgrown bushes on the cacao and the buffer zone to make it accessible for harvesting. Pruning is the removal of unproductive branches and helps increase yields per acre in the coming season by allowing the plant to direct energy to producing pods, which grow directly on the tree trunk.

loans.use: to clean and prune cacao

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
Yesica, de 39 años es una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de superarse, esta casada con Heyner quien es chofer, cuentan con una casa propia en la cual viven con sus dos menores hijos. El trabajo de Yesica consiste en visitar la casa de sus amigos , vecinos y conocidos en busca de pedidos para asi realizar sus ventas a través de los catálogos, en estas se ofrecen , cosmeticos , perfumes, joyas, etc. También realiza esta actividad en su casa en donde armo un pequeño puesto de venta en donde coloca algunos de los productos . Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que aporta en la economía de su hogar, espera poner mas adelante una pequeña pero muy surtida boutique  donde pueda exhibir todos los productos que ofrece. 
Este es el cuarto préstamo con MFP, le grada mucho el grupo que conforma, además espera poder cumplir como lo ha hecho hasta ahora, tiene muchas expectativas para el futuro y espera mantener su historial crediticio impecable para que de esta manera pueda seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará productos por catalogo los cuales estan  en promoción,tales como cosmeticos , perfumes, talcos, desodorantes entre otros, para asi tenerlos en stock y poder maximizar su ganancia.
texts.en:
Yesica is a 39 year old entrepreneurial woman who wants to excel.  She is married to Heyner who is a chauffeur, and together they own a house where they live with their two youngest children.  Yesica's work consists of visiting the homes of her friends, neighbors and acquaintances to gather orders from catalogs that offer cosmetics, perfumes, jewelry, etc.  She also works directly from home where she has small display of some of her products.  She likes her job because it contributes economically to her household, and she hopes to eventually open a small boutique that is well-stocked with the goods she offers.  

This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is very thankful to be part of the group.  Additionally, she hopes to continue to be successful as she has many expectations for the future, and she wants to maintain her impeccable credit.  With the loan of 1200 soles, she will buy catalog products that are on sale such as cosmetics, perfumes, powders, deodorants, and other things to have in-stock and to maximize her profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro, age 54, lives in the village of Santa Cruz on the Southern Highway, which connects Belize with Guatemala. Pedro and his wife Julia have been involved in cacao farming for a number of years now. He manages two acres of mature cacao trees and two acres of young trees. Pedro and Julia have brought up five children of which three are in school and two are farming cacao. 

Pedro got involved in cacao production when farmers were encouraged to plant cacao by the cacao association. Julia and the children help Pedro on the farm, especially at with picking and cracking ripe pods at harvest.  Besides cacao, Pedro also plants beans and corn for sale in the Guatemalan market. He also cultivates plantain and coconut for home use.

 “My favorite part of cacao is picking and seeing the farm after the cleaning is done” says Pedro. The challenging part for him is dealing with the squirrels that eat the cacao seeds from ripe pods. Cacao pods typically carry 35 seeds (beans) covered in delicious sweet and juicy pulp. Pedro says that cacao farming is going good because it has been his family’s bread and butter for four years now.

The family is requesting the loan to clean the two acres of young cacao trees that were planted last year.  Cleaning is the removal of underbrush in the cacao farm and is of vital importance in plots with young trees to ensure their survival. A cacao farmer working the lush tropical lowlands of Belize have to repeat cleaning as many as three times a year to keep airflow in the farm and keep the trees accessible.

loans.use: To clean cacao farm

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano and Rosenda are from the village of San Jose, Toledo’s cacao village extraordinaire. The couple has raised seven children, aged five months to 16 years. Three of the children are currently enrolled in school, and all but one still live in with the family. 

The family manages a small farm of an acre and a half, with around 600 cacao trees. Luciano started to plant some years ago encouraged by the local cooperative, the market opportunity for cacao and his brothers’ advice to start cultivating the crop. It was a great decision, he says, because cacao is “the number one cash crop.” He’s excited about cacao not only for its stable income-generating potential but also because it is a long-term crop that continues to produce pods for decades after it is planted. Luciano’s favorite part of cacao farming is seeing the field clean: “it looks really good!” The cleaning itself, however, is less fun because it requires hard work and takes up a lot of time. Cacao grows in the middle of lush jungle, meaning the farmers have to constantly fight underbrush growth to keep the trees healthy and accessible. 

Besides growing cacao, Luciano cultivates corn among other crops for home use. He is also currently in the Belize Defense Force, which he hopes he can retire from in two years to then fully focus on his farm. In the next few years, the family hopes to renovate their home to better accommodate the growing family. Luciano says the family plans to support the children in achieving the furthest education levels they have reason to want to pursue, but will also extend a helping hand if they instead choose to go into farming. 

The family is requesting this loan for cleaning their 600 cacao trees as well as bagging 500 seeds and lining the land for a planned expansion. Once bagged, cacao seeds take about six months to grow into a seedling that is ready for transplantation into the ground. Lining is the process of planning and marking the spots where seedlings will be planted to ensure a linear structure and sufficient spacing. The loan will pay for the equivalent of 30 days of hired labor in the community.

loans.use: To clean and expand cacao farm.

loans.name: Casamiro

texts.en:
Casamiro, age 45, lives in the village of San Jose, in the foothills of the Maya Mountains. He and his wife Jacinta have brought up ten children, eight of which are living in and two are currently in high school. Casamiro’s wife and kids help out on the farm, especially at harvest time.

Casamiro has been involved in cacao for seven years now and was encouraged to plant by a local NGO in southern Belize. For Casamiro cacao farming is good because it helps him take care of his family. “Good. It’s good because I sell the fruit, it helps me,” he told Maya Mountain Cacao in perfect English, his second language after Maya Mopan. Apart from cacao, the family also plants coffee, ginger, beans, corn, rice and vegetables for home use.

The favorite part of cacao for Casamiro is pruning. Prunning is the removal of the nonproductive branches and results in increased yields for the next year’s crop by letting the tree focus on producing pods that grow directly on the trunk. The more challenging part for Casamiro is cleaning, because a farmer cannot finish it on their own and have to hire outside help. 

The family is requesting this loan to clean their two acres of cacao farm and to establish a nursery for a planned cacao farm expansion. Cleaning is the removal of underbrush to facilitate airflow and keep trees accessible for pruning and harvesting. The family will establish a nursery where they will have the young cacao seedling grow until it’s ready for transplanting. Seedlings are typically strong enough for transplantation when they have four leaves, and take about six months to grow to that stage. The tasks at hand will require and create the equivalent of 18 days of labor in the community.

loans.use: To clean cacao and establish a centralized nursery

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.en:
Isidoro, age 58,  lives in the village of San Jose, where he has been farming cacao for over 30 years. San Jose, a village with almost the entire population of cacao farmers, rests in the foothills of the Maya mountains. Isidoro and his wife Modesta have raised eight children, with the youngest still in school. The family owns six acres of cacao planted by Isidoro 30 years back. Besides cacao the family also grows corn and rice for home use.
Isidoro got into cacao because it is a permanent crop that doesn’t require replanting every year. “My favorite part of cacao is the harvesting because I know that I am going to collect some money very soon” says Isidoro. The challenging part of cacao for him is the birds, as they damage ripe pods and create production loss. 
 The family is requesting this loan to hire help clean their cacao farm. Cleaning is the removal of the overgrown bush in the cacao farm and its surroundings to make it accessible for pruning and harvesting. Part of the loan will also be used for hiring people from the village to help with harvesting. Mature cacao trees need to be harvested every one to two weeks during peak cacao season, the months January to May. The task at hand will require the equivalent of 25 workdays for cleaning and two workdays every two weeks for harvesting.

loans.use: To hire help with cacao farm cleaning and harvest

loans.name: C20012 Kopaki Group

texts.en:
Vincent is 47 years old, married, and has two children, 8 and 12 years old. Vincent cultivates and sells rice in his business. He currently employs two people to help him. He is the leader of his group, which is called 'C20012 Kopaki' in the local language. He is the one raising his hand, in the photo. Vincent has five years of experience in the rice business. 

Vincent has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. He will use his part of the group's loan to purchase more fertilizer, for cultivating a large quantity of rice for sale. With the profit, Vincent will save money for the future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer, for cultivating a large quantity of rice for sale.

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es: Con su credikiva Rosmeri adquirió artículos varios como productos de belleza, ropa interior entre otros, lo cual vendió a buen precio y por ello pudo comprar una fotocopiadora, con la que se encuentra muy contenta, pues adicionó este servicio que requerían con mucho énfasis sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con le cual comprará un computador pues ofrecerá el servicio de transcripciones e impresiones y financiará su cartera de crédito. Lo cual hace su inversión sea muy exitosa,  porque se fundamenta en la demanda del mercado y en la excelente experiencia y capacidad de trabajo con la que cuenta Rosmeri.
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Rosmeri bought various beauty products such as underwear and other things that she sold at a good price, and thus was able to purchase a photocopier.  She was very pleased because is now able to offer a service that many of her customers need.  

Rosmeri is now applying for another loan with which she will purchase a computer so she can offer additional services.  She believes her investment will be very successful because it is founded in market demand in addition to her experience.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Juilio Cesar

texts.es: Julio tiene 48 años de edad, es casado. Él desde muy pequeño sentía entusiasmo por reparar bicicletas y empezó reparando la de él. Así fue que poco a poco, fue instalando su propio taller; por lo que, solicita a Fundación Campo un préstamo para comprar productos para mantener su inventario en el taller de reparación de bicicletas y dar abasto a la demanda. Comprando más productos que no tiene disponibles, en un futuro desea mejorar su local en donde tiene instalado su taller.
texts.en: Julio is 48 years old and married.  Since he was very young, he has been enthusiastic about repairing bicycles, and he began by repairing his own.  He continued little by little, and eventually opened his own shop for which he is asking for this loan.  He will buy products to maintain his inventory and to keep up with demand.  In the future, he hopes to update the storefront where he has his workshop.

loans.use: para comprar productos para mantener su inventario en el taller de reparación de bicicletas.

loans.name: Latisia

texts.en:
Latisia is a 54-year-old, married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as a humble woman.

She operates a grocery retail business, where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fertile potential business environment, and her customers are primarily the general public. She says her biggest business challenge is stiff competition in the area.

Latisia will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables to sell. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dromo Group

texts.en:
Dromo group consists of three members, namely Theresa, Alusi, and Doris. They decided to access credit from ID Ghana beginning in 2011. They sell provisions, fruits, and soaps respectively.
Theresa is a 34-year-old provisions seller. She has been in business with 3 years’ experience and works from Monday to Saturday. She buys from Makola market in Accra and sells in the Dansoman community.
This is her third loan with ID Ghana, and she needs a loan of 600 GHS to buy more goods to sell to her customers.
The entire group needs an amount of 1,400 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, such as milk, Milo, rice, sugar, and chocolate, to supply to customers.

loans.name: Diego Jaen Carlos

texts.es:
Diego es un joven de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad con muchas playas hermosas, atractivos turísticos maravillosos y también una gastronomía variada. Diego es un joven que desde pequeño tuvo la necesidad de poder trabajar ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos, es por ello que solo pudio estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar una carrera universitaria.

En horas de la madrugada Diego se levanta para poder trabajar ya que el es pescador, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyara en casa con los gastos del hogar, el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y amable con los clientes.

Diego está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, base, arena, hormigón, entre otros para poder terminar de construir una parte de su vivienda, de esta manera el podrá ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda y darle una mejor calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
Diego is a 21-year-old young man. He lives in Pisco city, a city with beautiful beaches, marvelous tourist attractions, and a variety of local cuisine. Since he was very young, Diego has had to work. His parents are poor. This is why he only completed his education to the fifth year of secondary school. He would have liked to go to university.
In the early morning hours, Diego goes to work as a fisherman. He works about ten hours a day. With his earnings he is able to help with the household expenses. He believes he is moving forward as he is responsible and is friendly to his customers.
Diego is very appreciative for the KIVA loans, as thanks to their help he is able to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, bedrock, concrete and the other items he needs to finish the construction of a part of their house. In this way he can improve the quality of life for his family and continue to strive to meet his long-term goal of finishing his home and giving a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es: María Lucila vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en el lugar de su residencia, tiene varios años de trabajar con el pequeño negocio y ha adquirido experiencia valiosa que le permite agilizar la producción de tortillas, gracias al buen manejo de la venta siempre obtiene las mejores ganancias, la comunidad donde vive es muy transitada y ya tiene mucha clientela, aunque sus mejores clientes son los vecinos, todos la prefieren porque su producto es de calidad, a un precio accesible y sobre todo con el servicio mas rápido del lugar; María es una mujer activa, y muy dedicada a su labor, desea salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños por eso todos los días se esfuerza al máximo en el trabajo pues sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito que tanto espera, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, leña, etc. María Lucila tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
María Lucila lives with her life partner and their children in their own house.  She works selling tortillas where she lives.  She has been working with her small business for several years and has acquired valuable experience that lets her speed up her tortilla production.  Thanks to good sales management, she always obtains the best profits.  The community where she lives is very transient and she has many customers, even though her best customers are her neighbors.  Everyone prefers her because her goods are of good quality, at a reasonable price, and more than anything come with the fastest service in the area.

María is an active woman and is very dedicated to her work.  She wants to get ahead and fulfill her dreams.  For this reason, every day she tries her very best at work, because she knows that only in this way will she obtain the success that she hopes for so much.

In the past few weeks, demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of it by making a new investment, but she doesn't have sufficient funds to back it up.  Because of this, she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy wholesale corn, firewood, etc.  María Lucila has good payment references and is very responsible.  She guarantees that she will be able to settle her debt and at the same time has faith that she will bring financial stability to her home.

loans.use: wholesale corn and firewood.

loans.name: Xiomara Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Xiomara Antonia vive en la cuidad de Managua, Casada con dos hijos.

La actividad del negocio es venta de productos industriales como bombas para pozo, Esta solicitando el crédito para la inversión  de estos productos para aumentar su inventario y ofertarlos a su clientela  y obtener mayor ganancia para mejorar los ingreso de su familia.
texts.en:
Xiomara Antonia lives in the city of Managua and is married with two children.  Her work involves selling industrial products such as well pumps.

She is asking for a loan to use to invest in these products, expand her inventory, sell them at sale prices to her customers, and obtain better profits in order to improve her family's income.

loans.use: buy well pumps.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is an old man hailing from the village of Katembe in Isingiro. He grew up without his father because his mother was neglected by her husband at an early age. Because of such circumstance, he grew up with his mother, and they have been doing business trading goats on a small scale to earn a living. Due to their hard work, they expanded, and he was able to acquire the land where they constructed a semi-permanent house 15 years ago. However, this house is getting old to the extent that it is almost collapsing on them. John is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to renovate the house to accommodate his mother and the entire family, enabling them to live in a much better condition. In the photo is John in the center, his wife on the right, and the Ugafode Credit officer on the left.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Nana Adoja

texts.en:
Nana Adoja sells the kenkey (a steamed, fermented corn dough similar to a sourdough dumpling), in and around Nkontrodo near Elimina. She is a widow, and has four children.  

Nana has been selling her kenkey recipe for the past three years.  As a single parent, she is responsible for the support of her children, and uses her income for that very important purpose. Whatever she has left, she saves for the future and reinvests in her small but growing business.  

Her loan will be used to buy maize in bulk and other necessary ingredients for the preparation of her kenkey corn dough. She hopes to use the new profits from her growing business to further expand the business.

loans.use: buy maize for her corn dough, kenkey, which she sells.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a 44-year-old married man. He describes himself as hard working and trustworthy. 

Josphat operates a retail business where he sells cereals such as maize, beans, etc... His business is located within a busy area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. 

He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank to be used by his family members on household activities. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM, after managing to successfully repay a loan of KES 30,000.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for his family.

loans.name: Pedro De Jesus

texts.es: Pedro de Jesús vive junto a su compañera de vida Delmy y sus dos hijos en casa propia, él trabaja de albañil para diferentes obras de construcción es un trabajo estable y tiene varios años laborando lo que le ha dado experiencia en el rubro convirtiéndose asi en uno de los mejores, obtiene las mejores ganancias, su trabajo esta ubicado en un lugar accesible y muy cercano a su vivienda; Pedro es un hombre entregado a su labor, dispuesto a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus objetivos lo mas impórtate en su vida es su familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad de su hogar, la casa necesita modificaciones y quiere realizarlas lo mas pronto posible para la seguridad de todos, es un hombre comprometido y no duda que podrá realizar los cambios lo mas pronto posible obteniendo el éxito deseado, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, piso, herramientas etc. Pedro  de Jesús tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda, esta agradecido con la ayuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pedro de Jesús lives with his life partner, Delmy, and their two children in their own house. He works as a bricklayer at different construction sites. It is dependable work. He has been doing this work for many years. Since he has good experience, he is one of the best in his field and can command higher wages. His work is located in a site close to his house. Pedro is a hardworking man. He is determined to reach his objectives. The most important one is the well being of his family. In the past few weeks the deterioration of his house has made his family uncomfortable. The house needs renovation and he would like to do this as soon as possible so his family is secure. He is a man that keeps his word. He will make the necessary changes as soon as possible. In order to make these changes he needs funds. He doesn’t have the needed capital, which is why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan in order to buy cement, bricks, flooring, tools, etc. Pedro de Jesús has good references for paying his loan and he is responsible. He is thankful for the assistance. He hopes that he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, flooring and tools.

loans.name: Linda Carolina

texts.es: Linda Carolina vive junto a su compañero de vida Edgar y sus hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de velas y bisutería pulseras, aritos, entre otros,  además para ampliar el negocio y completar los gastos del hogar se dedicara a vender pan dulce y café, tiene varios años con este negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia desde su vivienda y de forma ambulante en las cercanías de la comunidad donde reside, es muy conocida y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y el excelente servicio; Linda es una mujer que se caracteriza por su amabilidad, honestidad y por ser muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por las metas que desea alcanzar y sabe que con esfuerzo y amor a su trabajo podrá lograr el éxito que tanto desea, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para ampliar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material de bisutería, pan dulce, café etc. Linda Carolina tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Linda Carolina lives with her life partner, Edgar, and their children in their own house.  She works selling candles, imitation bracelets, ear rings, etc.  In addition, she will work selling sweet bread and coffee in order to expand her business and pay the household expenses.

She has had this business for several years and has gained a lot of experience in sales, which allows her to get the best profits.  She works from her home and also as a street vendor in the outskirts of the community where she lives.  She is very well known and has gained many customers that prefer the quality of her goods, good prices, and excellent service.

Linda is a woman who is known for her kindness, honesty, and for being very dedicated to her work.  She is always striving towards the goals that she wants to reach and knows that with effort and love for her work, she will be able to see the success that she wants so much.

In recent weeks, demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of it by expanding her business and making a new investment, but she lacks sufficient funds to back it up.  For this reason, she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy trinkets, sweet bread, coffee, etc.

Linda Carolina has good payment references and impeccable morals.  She guarantees that she will settle her debt and at the same time has hope that it will give her family a full life.

loans.use: trinkets, sweet bread, and coffee.

loans.name: Marthline

texts.en: Marthline is 40 years old and lives in Jacob Town in Montserrado County, which is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. Marthline is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have seven children, all of whom attend school and live at home. For twenty years now, Marthline has been selling fashion clothes, such as jeans, trousers, t-shirts, and blouses in the local market. Most interestingly, her business helps her to earn more money for herself. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business. She plans to give her children a higher education in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 44 years old. He is married to Zipporah and supports a family of five members. He is a mixed farmer and has been in the business for the last eight years. His monthly income is 39,000 KES.
Simon is currently servicing his fourth loan of 75,000 KES from KADET LTD, which will facilitate his purchase of fertilizer and pesticides.
Simon plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. His future dream is to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies, such as fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамире 41 год, замужем, воспитала 2 сыновей. Дамира имеет среднее образование по характеру очень порядочная добросовестная в  качестве  дохода для своей семьи, ведет бизнес в животноводстве. Стартовав в 2003 году с начальной суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS), Дамира смогла развить свое хозяйство, приносящее около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от перепродажи скота. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Дамиры имеется две дойные коровы, и 10 коз. Доходы от бизнес- деятельности позволили Дамире оплатить учебу в университете для своих детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дамира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 12 овец. Доходы Дамира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и доходы намерена направить на образование сыновей.
texts.en: Damira is 41 years old, married, and raised two sons.  She received a higher education and, by character, she's respectable and has integrity.  She works with livestock as a source of income for her family.  She began her business in 2003 with 20,000 KGS.  In her care, the business has grown and she now earns around 10,000 KGS a month from reselling cattle.  To date, Damira has two milk cows and ten goats.  The income from her business allows her to pay tuition for the education her sons receive in university.  With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a sum of 60,000 KGS to buy twelve sheep.  Damira plans to reinvest the expected additional income back into her business to expand the number of cattle she owns, as well as to continue paying for her sons' educations.

loans.use: To purchase 12 sheep.

loans.name: Uzima Group

texts.en:
Moris’s group has 19 farmers and is located in Kakamega South District. Moris is pictured on the right of Uzima Group with his hand raised. Moris is pictured amongst the four men and fifteen women of his group. He will receive loans enabling him to plant 1/2 an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Moris joined One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains season and is now enrolling in the 2013 Long Rains season. Moris joined One Acre Fund to grow enough food for the family and to use his increased profits to send his children to school.
Moris described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Moris’s group members will receive agricultural loans to farm 1/2 acre each. In total, this group will receive agricultural loans for use on 9 and 1/2 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es: Alba con su previo credikiva compró al por mayor y de contado útiles educativos, artículos de papelería cosméticos, detalles para el hogar y surtió su miscelánea. Hoy tiene mayor liquidez y esto fue gracias a su credikiva, con le cual aumentó sus ventas y sus utilidades. Su inversión tendrá éxito porque posee una clientela fija, aplica precios justos a su clientela y tiene una amable atención con ellos. En la actualidad está aplicando una vez mas a un credikiva, con el cual comprará cosméticos y variedades de productos de miscelanea, mediante la modalidad de contado y en un mayor volumen. Ella expresa “un  mensaje  de mucho agradecimiento  a Kiva y a la FMSD y pide que continúen los financiamientos,  para continuar aumentando su nivel de vida y el de su familia. “
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Alba bought school supplies, stationery supplies, cosmetics, and home goods wholesale and for cash to supply her general store. Today, she has greater liquidity and this is thanks to her Kiva loan, with which she increased her sales and her profits. Her investment will be successful because she has loyal customers. She offers her customers fair prices and she attends to them in a friendly manner. Currently, she is applying for another loan, with which she will buy cosmetics and a variety of general store products, in cash and in bulk. She expresses "a very grateful message to Kiva and to FMSD and asks that they continue financing, to continue increasing her quality of life and that of her family."

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and a variety of general store products

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married with five children; her husband is a mason.  Efua operates a grocery shop at Elimina, which she has been doing for ten years.  She uses her income to support her husband with paying the family's utility bills.
	
The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of soft  drinks, milk, milo (a chocolate malt powder mixed with milk or water), sugar, soups, canned tomatoes, canned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc...   

She will use her loan to purchase a variety of soft drinks to sell. With the new profit, Efua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.es:
Merly, de 40 años esta casada con Roger quien es empleado público. Tiene su casa propia y habita cómodamente junto a sus 03 hijos.El trabajo de Merly  consiste en la venta de platos variados tales como, salchipapas, pollo frito, tallarín con pollo, etc. Se levanta temprano para ir al mercado a comprar todos los productos necesarios de la región y así poder empezar a preparar los deliciosos potajes que la coronan en su cuadra como la mejor cocinera , estas comidas se venden en la vereda de su hogar , en donde se acondicionó un lugar para que pueda realizar sus ventas. El dinero que ganaba su  esposo no cubría los gastos básicos necesarios del hogar, por ello tuvo la iniciativa de poner su propio negocio , le gusta su trabajo porque puede distraerse y al mismo tiempo generar sus ingresos, además tiene clientes todo el tiempo por eso espera empezar a vender en mayor cantidad y a su vez mejorar la infraestructura de sus muebles.
Este será el cuarto préstamo con MFP , sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas . Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos tales como arroz, papa, azúcar, entre otros para continuar con su trabajo, además de algunos utensilios que necesita para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Merly is forty years old and married to Roger, who is a government employee. They have their own house where they live comfortably with their three children. Merly sells prepared food such as fried pork skin, fried chicken, chicken casserole, etc. She gets up early in the morning to go to the market to buy all of the regional products she needs. Then she begins to prepare all the delicious dishes that come from her kitchen. She is known as the great cook. These dishes she sells from the lane next to her house. She has made this into a good place to sell her goods. The money that her husband earns does not cover their basic household expenses. This is why she started her own business. She likes this work as it provides her with something to do and also helps her earn income. She has customers all the time. This is why she wants to increase the quantity of the food she produces and also she wants to buy better tables and chairs
This is her fourth loan from MFP. She knows that she needs to be responsible and punctual with her loan payments. With the 1500 soles she is requesting she will buy ingredients and goods such as rice, potatoes, sugar among other goods in order to continue with her business. Also she will buy the utensils needed to continue with her work..

loans.use: to buy ingredients, goods and utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Dúo Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
DUO LUZ DE LA ESPERANZA
Doña Fidelina es originaria de Tecpan tiene 35 años de edad, tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la venta de ropa típica.
El esposo de ella trabaja como chofer  que transporta pasajeros de tecpan a otra colonia y con el sueldo que gana ayuda a mantener a su familia
El sueño de doña Fidelina es tener su propio local para su negocio, así podrá obtener mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela.  
Ha tenido dos créditos KIVA y con la puntualidad en sus pagos  no ha caído en mora.
texts.en:
DUO LUZ DE LA ESPERANZA (Light of Hope Duo)

Fidelina, 35, is originally from Tecpan. She is responsible for her three children. She works weaving typical textiles by hand and selling typical clothing. Her husband works as a driver who takes passengers from Tecpan to another town, and with the money he earns, he helps support his family. Fidelina's dream is to have her own establishment for her business. She will be able to have a better income and send her children to school. She has had two Kiva loans and since she has made her payments on time, she has not defaulted.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make typical textiles to sell.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca tiene 41 años, casada con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de  16 años, ella se dedica a la venta  de comida en su pensión que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Guapuru. Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Blanca  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un Frízer que le hace falta para conservar la carne, verduras,  y refrescos su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra frizer. La Sra. Blanca enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia. En la foto la Sra. Blanca se encuentra en compañía de su esposo.
texts.en: Blanca, 41, is married with one 16-year-old son. She works selling food in her diner, located in the Guapuru area. This is her first loan from the institution. Blanca will use this loan to buy a freezer that she needs to preserve meat, vegetables, and soft drinks. Her reason for applying for this loan is the lack of capital to buy a freezer. Blanca faces challenges in her business, such as growing her customer base. She will use the earnings to improve her family's quality of life. In the photo, Blanca is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de Encarnación esta en su tercer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Son 17 mujeres que se unieron para trabajar, pero en esta ocasión solo 15 de ellas retiran un crédito.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra Mirian, ella tiene su despensa en su casa, donde tiene todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, con lo que necesitan sus vecinos, está casada con el señor Eligio que es empleado de una empresa, tienen 2 hijos, por quienes ambos trabajan tenazmente para poder darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
Cuenta la Sra. Mirian que gracias a su grupo y al apoyo de sus amigas ha podido crecer mucho e ir progresando. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos para su despensa, como carne, verduras, panificados, lácteos, y demás.
texts.en:
This group, from the city of Encarnacíon, is on its third loan with the "Comité de Mujeres" (Women's Committee).  The group includes 17 women who came together to work, but at this time only 15 of them are taking out a loan.

One of the members of the group is Mirian.  She has a pantry in her house where she has all kinds of basic essential goods, which are needed by her neighbors.  She is married to Eligio, who works for a company.  They have 2 children, on whose behalf they both work relentlessly so they can give them everything they need to have a life without deprivation.

Mirian says that thanks to her group and the support of her friends, she has been able to grow a lot and progress.  She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in buying goods for her pantry to sell, such as meat, vegetables, baked goods, dairy products, etc.

loans.use: buy meat, vegetables, baked goods, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es: Yolanda del Carmen vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos, pasteles, enchiladas, empanadas, pupusas entre, tiene mucha experiencia en las ventas y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que le permite estar adelante de la competencia pues todo lo que elabora tiene un sabor inigualable, preparado con material de primera calidad, a un buen precio pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio a la orden de las personas que la visitan y comercia desde un lugar que califico como excelente para sus actividades; Yolanda es una mujer que ama su labor, trabaja desde muy temprano para al final del día poder compartir con lo mas importante para ella su familia, es emprendedora, enérgica y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere alcanzar el éxito y no descansara hasta lograrlo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda de su producto y necesita aumentar la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar una plancha para pupusas con freidora,  maíz, quesos, chicharrón, etc. Yolanda del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y al mismo tiempo tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Yolanda del Carmen lives with her life partner and their two children in their own house. She sells prepared local cuisine such as pastries, enchiladas, empanadas, papusas, etc. She has a lot of experience selling these goods and has a lot of customers. She has managed to stay ahead of the competition, as all that she makes has a unique flavor and is prepared with ingredients of excellent quality. She sells her products for a good price and provides excellent service. Yolanda is a woman that loves her work. She works from early in the morning until late at night in order to help her family. She is enterprising, energetic and has a great desire to succeed. She wants to be successful and she won’t rest until she achieves this goal. In the last few weeks the demand for her products has increased. She needs to increase her investment in her business, which is why she is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will help her buy a grill and fryer needed to make her papusas, corn, cheeses, fried pig skin, etc. Yolanda del Carmen is responsible according to her friends. She will be able to pay her payments on time. At the same time she has faith that she will be able to improve the economic conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy a grill with a fryer for her papusas, corn, cheese, fried pig skin.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Doña paula es una mujer feliz, luchadora, emprendedora y que a pesar de sus 53 años de edad ella no deja de soñar en grande, ella tiene un grado de educación primario no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 5 hijos de los cuales en familia trabajan la agricultura, ella aprendió esta actividad hace más de 7 años inculcada por hoy en día su esposo, su producto es comercializado y vendido en los alrededores de su hogar con algunos vecinos, personas que lo comercializa en pequeña escala en el mercado local y otros. Esta actividad les ha dado fruto por mucho tiempo y es el único medio de ingreso que ellos tienen para el sustento de su familia y su hogar cubriendo las necesidades básicas como ser alimentación, vestimenta, medicinas, etc. Que a diario se presentan.

Doña paula solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas, y una bomba de fumigación para su cultivo de café, ya que hoy en día este clase de productos son caros y la (roya) que es una enfermedad que afecta los cultivos de café si no se trata a tiempo es posible que se contamine y se pierda la cosecha completa.

Sus sueños a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación por sus hijos, sus nietos, y las próximas generaciones que puedan aprovechar el esfuerzo y la dedicación de ella y de su esposo.
texts.en:
Doña Paula is a happy, hard-working, and enterprising woman who, despite being 53 years old, has not stopped dreaming big.  She has an incomplete elementary school level of education because she only studied up to the third grade.  She is married and has five children who work in agriculture with the family.  She learned this activity more than 7 years ago from her husband.  Her product is marketed and sold in the areas surrounding her home to various neighbors, people who sell it on a small scale in the local market, and others.  This work has provided for them for a long time and is the only source of income that they have to maintain their family and their home by covering the basic needs that occur daily, like food, clothing, medicine, etc.  

Doña Paula asks for help so that she can buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide, and a fumigation pump for her coffee crops because nowadays these kinds of products are expensive and because it is possible that roya, a sickness that affects coffee crops, could contaminate her crops if not treated in time, and she could lose her entire harvest.

Her dream for the future is to have a large coffee plantation that would continue to provide blessings and a means of living for her family, and could be worked from generation to generation by her children, grandchildren, and the next generations able to take advantage of the effort and dedication of her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide, and a fumigation pump for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 to 12. She describes herself as a focused and ambitious woman. She operates a food stall and dairy farm where she sells cereals and milk. Her business is located within a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge  as the high prices of cereals. She will use this 10,000 KES loan to buy cereals to sell. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM .

loans.use: to buy cereals for her grocery store to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar Armando vive junto a su vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia; él posee un taller de reparación de libros,  los empasta al gusto del cliente tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite realizar su trabajo al cien porciento, logrando alcanzar las ganancias esperadas, es muy conocido por las personas del lugar y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque es muy confiable, tiene excelentes precios y un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Oscar se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y honestidad es muy humilde y siempre esta dedicado a su labor, le gusta luchar por lo que desea por eso se esfuerza dia a dia para ganarse un futuro mas prospero y así obtener el éxito que se merece, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda  y no posee de suficiente materia prima por lo que necesita realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito comprar cartón, hilo, forro, papel etc. Oscar Armando tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable se siente muy contenta con la colaboración y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Oscar Armando lives with his two children in his own house. He has a book-repair shop where he binds books according to his customers' wishes. He has had this business for several years, and it has given him valuable experience that allows him to do his work at 100% capacity, achieving the profits he had hoped for. 

Oscar is very well-known by the local people and has many customers. People prefer him because he is very trustworthy, has excellent prices, and provides unequaled customer service. Oscar is known for his friendliness and honesty; he is very humble and is always dedicated to his work. He likes to strive to achieve what he wants, so he works hard day after day to earn a more prosperous future and attain the success that he deserves. 

In recent weeks, demand has increased, and Oscar doesn't have sufficient raw materials; therefore, he needs to make a new investment, but he doesn't have enough capital. That's why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy cardboard, thread, book jackets, paper, etc. 

Oscar Armando has good credit references and is very responsible. He feels very happy with this collaboration and says that he will be able to pay off the debt; he also has faith that he will bring economic security to his home.

loans.use: to purchase cardboard, thread, book jackets, and paper.
